{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2963590,"name":"Saar","username":"Saar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-31T11:06:46.065Z","cooked":"

When trying to run ./gradlew build in intelli, I received this error:

Task :compileJava FAILED
Compilation Error!
GradleRIO detected this build failed due to a Compile Error (compileJava).
Check that all your files are saved, then scroll up in this log for more information.

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

  • What went wrong:
    Execution failed for task ‘:compileJava’.

Could not target platform: ‘Java SE 11’ using tool chain: ‘JDK 8 (1.8)’.

  • Try:
    Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. Run
    with --scan to get full insights.

  • Get more help at https://help.gradle.org

Deprecated Gradle features were used in this build, making it incompatible with Gradle 7.0.
Use ‘–warning-mode all’ to show the individual deprecation warnings.
See Command-Line Interface

BUILD FAILED in 2s
1 actionable task: 1 executed

Based on this line: Deprecated Gradle features were used in this build, making it incompatible with Gradle 7.0., I ran this command: ./gradlew wrapper --gradle-version 7.1.1

But then when I tried to build again it gave me this error:

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

  • Where:
    Build file ‘C:\Users\saarz\Documents\robot-2021\build.gradle’ line: 3

  • What went wrong:
    An exception occurred applying plugin request [id: ‘edu.wpi.first.GradleRIO’, version: ‘2021.3.1’]

Failed to apply plugin class ‘jaci.gradle.deploy.DeployPlugin’.
Could not create an instance of type jaci.gradle.deploy.DeployExtension.
Could not create an instance of type jaci.gradle.deploy.target.TargetsExtension.
org.gradle.api.internal.DefaultNamedDomainObjectSet.(Ljava/lang/Class;Lorg/gradle/internal/reflect
/Instantiator;)V

  • Try:
    Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output. Run
    with --scan to get full insights.

  • Get more help at https://help.gradle.org

BUILD FAILED in 758ms

Would really appreciate any help. Thanks in advance.

As the stacktrace says

Could not target platform: ‘Java SE 11’ using tool chain: ‘JDK 8 (1.8)’.

You have to use Java 11

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2021-07-31T13:59:02.930Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395314,"topic_slug":"trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij","display_username":"Dalton Smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Docs Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij/395314/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Docs Maintainer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2963609,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-31T15:32:54.714Z","cooked":"

As Dalton says above, it’s because intellij is using the wrong JDK. You will also have to manually revert the update to gradle 7. That warning is saying gradle 7 won’t work. 6.0.1 is the only supported gradle version. You will have to manually update the gradle-wrapper.properties file to point back to 6.0.1

But was using 11. Why did it think I was using 8?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2021-07-31T17:12:28.973Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395314,"topic_slug":"trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij","display_username":"Saar","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49110,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij/395314/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2963616,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-07-31T17:25:37.470Z","cooked":"

Intellij I think defaults to its own internal jdk. Which is 8 iirc. You have to tell it to use 11. I’m not sure how though, it’s a setting somewhere.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2021-07-31T17:25:37.470Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395314,"topic_slug":"trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49110,"username":"Saar","name":"Saar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/7bcc69/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij/395314/5","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2963627,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-31T18:22:44.392Z","cooked":"

There’s a JDK section in the settings, you want to tell IntelliJ to use the JDK at C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2021\jdk (I might be wrong about the exact path, but that’s the WPILib-installed JDK).

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2021-07-31T18:22:44.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":12.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395314,"topic_slug":"trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738a | ISR | WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/trying-to-run-gradlew-build-in-intellij/395314/6","custom_user_title":"6738a | ISR | WPILib","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2963637,"name":"jdao","username":"jdao","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdao/{size}/160969_2.png","created_at":"2021-07-31T22:29:24.150Z","cooked":"

To set projects in IntelliJ to use the WPILib JDK, go to File->Project Structure (Ctrl+Alt+Shift+S) and set the Project SDK. The first time you set it up, you need to add the WPILib Java SDK to the list of available SDKs by pointing it to the install location (For Windows, it will be something like C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2021\jdk).

After that, you also need to tell IntelliJ to use Java 11 for Gradle as well. You do this by going to Settings (Ctrl+Alt+S), then go to Build, Execution, Deployment->Build Tools->Gradle. In the Gradle JVM Option, tell it to use the Project SDK, which will now be Java 11 after setting it up with the above step.
